Sentencas: Apatite-type silicates have been considered as promising electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFC): however studies on the potential use of these materials in SOFC devices have received relatively little attention.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The lanthanum silicate with composition La10Si5.5Al0.5O26.75 has been evaluated as electrolyte with the electrode materials commonly used in SOFC, i.e. manganite, ferrite and cobaltite as cathode materials and NiO-CGO composite, chromium-manganite and Sr2MgMoO6 as anode materials.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Chemical compatibility, area-specific resistance and fuel cell studies have been performed.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) analysis did not reveal any trace of reaction products between the apatite electrolyte and most of the aforementioned electrode materials.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: However, the area-specific polarisation resistance (ASR) of these electrodes in contact with apatite electrolyte increased significantly with the sintering temperature, indicating reactivity at the electrolyte/electrode interface.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: On the other hand, the ASR values are significantly improved using a ceria buffer layer between the electrolyte and electrode materials to prevent reactivity.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Maximum power densities of 195 and 65 mWcm(-2) were obtained at 850 and 700 degrees C, respectively in H-2 fuel, using an 1 mm-thick electrolyte, a NiO-Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 composite as anode and La0.6Sr0.4Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta as cathode materials.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: This fuel cell was tested for 100 h in 5%H-2-Ar atmosphere showing stable performance.
Titulo: Evaluation of apatite silicates as solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes
